Welcome to the Zimmer engine documentation!

Types

Vec2 = ref object of RootObj
  x, y: float32
This is Zimmer's implementation of Vector2. 
Color = ref object of RootObj
  r, g, b, a: uint8
This is the Zimmer's implementation of Color. 
Object = ref object of RootObj
  pos, size, velocity: Vec2
  color: Color
  damping: float32
  z_index: int32
  fill: bool
This is an Object. Every visible thing on the screen is (to an extent) an Object. Objects are rendered as rects. Use TexObject to render textures. They are kept in a seq[] in the scene, which then gets passed to the engine to render, apply physics and more. 
Scene = ref object of RootObj
  objects: seq[Object]
This is the Scene object. It contains all of the objects that are shown in the current scene. Scenes are passed to the engine to be rendered, to get it's physics updated, ect. 
Engine = ref object of RootObj
  window: WindowPtr
  renderer: RendererPtr
  scene: Scene
  bgcolor: Color
  window_size, mouse_pos: Vec2
  keyboard: ptr array[0 .. 512, uint8]
  running: bool
This is the Engine object. The Engine is what it is. It renders, it updates physics, it handles input and more.

Procs

proc newVec2(x: SomeNumber; y: SomeNumber): Vec2
Initiates a new Vec2 object. It takes in the vector's x and y coordinates. 
proc rotate(self: Vec2; input_angle: SomeNumber)
Rotates the Vec2. It takes in a radian and rotates the Vec2 accordingly. This does not return a modified Vec2, it instead rotates the Vec2 passed in. If you want to pass in a degree instead of a radian, use d2r() accordingly. 
proc newColor(r: uint8; g: uint8; b: uint8; a: uint8): Color {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Initiates a new Color object. It takes in the red, green, blue and alpha values. 
proc newColor(all: uint8; a: uint8): Color {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Initiates a new Color object. It takes in red, green and blue as one value and alpha value seperately. 
proc newColor(all: uint8): Color {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Initiates a new Color object. It takes in red, green and blue as one value. Alpha defaults to 255. 
proc newObject(pos, size: Vec2; color: Color; z_index: int32; fill: bool): Object {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Initiates a new Object object. It takes in the object's position, size, color, z_index and fill arguments respectively. 
proc apply_impulse(self: Object; impulse: Vec2) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Applies impulse to the Object. Uses a Vec2 for the impulse. 
proc apply_impulse(self: Object; x: SomeNumber; y: SomeNumber)
Applies impulse to the Object. Uses the x and y values for the impulse. 
proc update_physics(self: Object) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Updates position and velocity of the Object. Doesn't take in any arguments except the Object. 
proc newScene(): Scene {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates new Scene object. 
proc add_object(self: Scene; obj: Object) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
This adds an object to the seq in the Scene. 
proc remove_object(self: Scene; idx: SomeNumber)
This removes an object from the seq in the Scene. 
proc clamp(num: SomeNumber; min: SomeNumber; max: SomeNumber): SomeNumber
Clamps and returns a value (num) between a minimum value (min) and a maximum value (max). 
proc d2r(degree: SomeNumber): float
Converts degrees to radians. 
proc r2d(radian: SomeNumber): float
Converts radians to degrees. 
proc newEngine(bgcolor: Color; window_size: Vec2; window_name: string): Engine {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates new Engine object. Requires background color and window size as paramaters. 
proc handle_keyboard(self: Engine) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Updates engine's 'keyboard' value. To see what keys are pressed, compare it with the SDL_SCANCODEs in an if statement. 
proc handle_events(self: Engine) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Handles window exit event and mouse movement. 
proc set_scene(self: Engine; scene: Scene) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Sets current scene of the engine. This scene will be rendered if render() is called. 
proc render_object(self: Engine; obj: Object) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Renders a single object. DO NOT USE THIS! THIS IS USED BY render() ONLY! 
proc render(self: Engine) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Renders all objects in the current scene. Doesn't need any arguments. 
proc update_physics(self: Engine) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Updates the positions in all of the objects in the current scene.
